questions.text: An elderly male with coronary artery disease, heart failure (LVEF 30%), and hypertension presents without new symptoms. BP is 108/56 mmHg, HR is 88/min, SpO2 9 is 98%. ECG is shown below. His ECG was normal ECG six months ago. Which treatment is most indicated?

options.label: A
options.text: Systemic anticoagulation with warfarin or NOAC

questions.correct_answer: A. Systemic anticoagulation with warfarin or NOAC
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Systemic anticoagulation with warfarin or NOAC

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ High CHA₂DS₂-VASc scores in AF prioritize anticoagulation over rhythm control in stable patients.

questions.text: A 6-month-old infant with poor weight gain and cyanotic spells has a harsh systolic murmur at the left upper sternal border. Echocardiogram confirms a congenital defect. Which is not a feature of this disease?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Tricuspid atresia

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ TOF includes VSD, pulmonary stenosis, overriding aorta, and RV hypertrophy; tricuspid atresia is unrelated.

questions.text: A 67-year-old man with prior MI and reduced LV function has sudden dizziness. ECG shows regular wide-complex tachycardia at 170/min. Which finding suggests SVT with aberrancy over VT?

options.label: A
options.text: No R wave in lead aVR

questions.correct_answer: A. No R wave in lead aVR
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) No R wave in lead Avr

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In wide-complex tachycardia, no R wave in aVR supports SVT with aberrancy, but VT is more common in structural heart disease.

questions.text: A middle-aged woman with a thoracic aortic aneurysm on CT has a bifid uvula, hypertelorism, and corkscrew carotid arteries on neck CT. MRI is shown below. Which gene mutation is most likely?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) TGF-β receptor

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Loeys-Dietz syndrome, due to TGF-β receptor mutations, requires vigilance for vascular complications.

questions.text: A 45-year-old man with metastatic adenocarcinoma has sudden dyspnea, BP 70/30 mmHg, HR 142/min, distended JVP, clear lungs, and faint heart sounds. ECG is shown below. Which parameter is decreased?
questions.correct_answer: B. Left ventricular end diastolic volume
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Left ventricular end diastolic volume

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Cardiac tamponade reduces LVEDV due to restricted filling, requiring urgent pericardiocentesis.

questions.text: A 45-year-old man post-tamponade stabilization has brief palpitations. ECG reveals atrial premature contractions (APCs). He is stable with mild discomfort. What is accurate about his rhythm?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Reassure, no further testing

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Benign APCs in stable patients require reassurance, not further workup.

questions.text: A 22-year-old baseball player has right arm pain after overhead throwing, described as tight and aching. Pain is reproduced with arm abduction and external rotation. What is the likely diagnosis?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Thoracic outlet syndrome

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ TOS is suspected in athletes with positional arm symptoms; arterial TOS mimics claudication.

questions.text: A 45-year-old man with suspected pulmonary hypertension has oxygen saturations: SVC 61%, IVC 65%, right atrium 85%, right ventricle 84%, pulmonary artery 84%. What explains these findings?

options.label: B
options.text: Atrial septal defect with left-to-right shunt

questions.correct_answer: B. Atrial septal defect with left-to-right shunt
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Atrial septal defect with left-to-right shunt

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Right atrial oxygen step-up suggests ASD with left-to-right shunting, guiding management.

questions.text: A 68-year-old man with cardiomyopathy and ICD has three ICD shocks in 15 minutes, then a fourth an hour later. He feels sore but okay. He takes metoprolol, lisinopril, aspirin, eplerenone. What is the Next step?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Emergency hospital transport

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ ICD storm is a medical emergency requiring immediate hospital evaluation.

questions.text: A 52-year-old man with hypertension and diabetes has dyspnea, orthopnea, and leg swelling. Exam shows elevated JVP and S4. Echocardiogram shows EF 55%, enlarged left atrium, suggesting HFpEF. Which treatment reduces mortality?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) None of the above

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ HFpEF lacks mortality-reducing therapies; focus on symptom and comorbidity management.

questions.text: A 25-year-old runner with palpitations has stress and high coffee intake. ECG shows sinus rhythm with two early wide QRS complexes. Which statement about PVCs is accurate?

options.label: A
options.text: QRS pattern may indicate structural heart disease

options.label: B
options.text: Dominant R wave in V1 indicates RV origin

options.label: C
options.text: PVCs in ischemia are unrelated to VT

questions.correct_answer: A. QRS pattern may indicate structural heart disease
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) QRS pattern may indicate structural heart disease

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ PVC QRS morphology helps differentiate benign from pathological cases, guiding further evaluation.

questions.text: A 59-year-old man post-anterior MI and PCI has palpitations. Labs: potassium 3.2 mEq/L, magnesium 1.1 mEq/L. ECG is shown below. Which is not recommended?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Start IV lidocaine

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Post-MI PVCs are managed with electrolyte correction and beta-blockers, not routine lidocaine.

questions.text: A 68-year-old with hypertension and CAD is evaluated for heart failure. Besides dyspnea and fatigue, which symptom can indicate heart failure?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) All of the above

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ HF presents with non-cardiac symptoms like RUQ pain, satiety issues, and nocturia, requiring holistic assessment.

questions.text: In HFrEF, which is not typically increased?
questions.correct_answer: D. Calcium reuptake into sarcoplasmic reticulum
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Calcium reuptake into sarcoplasmic reticulum

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ HFrEF involves neurohormonal activation, but calcium reuptake is impaired, worsening systolic function.

questions.text: A 64-year-old man with palpitations is stable with minimal symptoms. ECG is shown below. Which statement about management is accurate?

options.label: C
options.text: Rate control is easier than in AF

questions.correct_answer: B. Catheter ablation is highly successful
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Catheter ablation is highly successful

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Catheter ablation is preferred for typical atrial flutter due to high efficacy; anticoagulation mirrors AF. Image Cue : ECG with sawtooth flutter waves.

questions.text: A 19-year-old with acute heart failure has reduced LV function. Biopsy confirms viral myocarditis. What is the most appropriate treatment?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Lisinopril

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Viral myocarditis is treated with heart failure therapies like ACE inhibitors; avoid anti-inflammatories/antivirals.

questions.text: A 28-year-old man has palpitations during stressful singing. ECG is shown below. Echo/MRI are normal. What is the arrhythmia source?
questions.correct_answer: B. Right ventricular outflow tract VT
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Right ventricular outflow tract VT

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ RVOT VT is benign, stress-triggered, with LBBB and inferior axis in healthy individuals.

questions.text: A 24-year-old woman has lightheadedness and tachycardia (HR 135 bpm) upon standing post-viral infection. BP is stable. What is a reasonable treatment?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Any of the above

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ POTS is managed with volume expansion and mechanical support to reduce symptoms.

questions.text: A 57-year-old man with pulmonary embolism has BP 127/83 mmHg, SpO2 97%, exertional dyspnea. Echocardiogram shows dilated, hypokinetic RV. Troponin/BNP elevated. What is his risk category regarding the diagnosis?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Submassive

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Submassive PE involves RV dysfunction/biomarkers with normal BP, guiding risk-based therapy. Image Cue : Echocardiogram showing dilated, hypokinetic RV.
  • ➤ Image Cue

questions.text: Which statement about inpatient VTE prevention is not true?

options.label: A
options.text: Mechanical prophylaxis for bleeding risk patients

options.label: D

Ans. D) Routine VTE prophylaxis is not essential

questions.text: A 72-year-old woman with ischemic cardiomyopathy (EF 35%), NYHA class II, on lisinopril, carvedilol, spironolactone, has stable vitals. Which drug adds mortality benefit?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) None of the above

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Optimal HFrEF therapy includes ACEi, beta-blockers, MRAs; additional drugs have specific indications.

questions.text: A 58-year-old man with chest pressure has ECG shows with 2 mm ST depression in V2–V3. Which statement about ischemia ECG findings is accurate?

options.label: A
options.text: Q waves precede ST elevation in transmural MI

options.label: B
options.text: ST depression is more reliable for localization

options.label: D
options.text: ST depression in V1–V3 indicates posterior MI

questions.correct_answer: D. ST depression in V1–V3 indicates posterior MI
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) ST depression in V1–V3 indicates posterior MI

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ ST depression in V1–V3 suggests posterior MI, requiring posterior leads for confirmation.

questions.text: A 65-year-old man with orthopnea, nocturnal cough, and leg swelling has suspected heart failure. Echocardiogram shows the presence of HF. Which statement about orthopnea is accurate?

options.label: C
options.text: Due to blood moving to gut/limbs

questions.correct_answer: B. Can occur in abdominal obesity
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Can occur in abdominal obesity

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Orthopnea occurs in HF and obesity, relieved by upright posture, due to central fluid shifts.

questions.text: A 45-year-old with leg aching has dilated, tortuous veins. Which is not a conservative treatment for varicose veins?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Daily aspirin

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Varicose vein treatment is mechanical; aspirin is not indicated.

questions.text: A 72-year-old non-smoker is tired while gardening. Vitals, labs, CXR, ECG normal. Echocardiogram normal. Treadmill ECG shows peak HR 96 bpm, no ST changes. What explains his symptoms?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Chronotropic incompetence

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Chronotropic incompetence causes exercise intolerance with blunted HR response, diagnosed via stress testing.

questions.text: A 75-year-old man, 7 days post-angiography presents with nausea, abdominal pain, oliguria, fever (38.3°C), livedo reticularis, creatinine 2.7 mg/dL (baseline 1.1), eosinophilia. What is the diagnosis?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Atheroembolic renal disease

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Atheroembolic renal disease is a delayed post-procedural complication with systemic signs, unlike contrast nephropathy.

questions.text: Which physical sign is not expected in chronic aortic regurgitation?
questions.correct_answer: D. Systolic ejection murmur to neck
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Systolic ejection murmur to neck

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ AR causes peripheral signs from wide pulse pressure; systolic murmurs to neck indicate aortic stenosis.

questions.text: A 68-year-old woman with chemotherapy-induced cardiomyopathy (EF 15%), NYHA III–IV, VO₂ 9 mL/kg/min, ineligible for transplant, is on maximal therapy. Echocardiogram confirms severe LV dysfunction. What is the Next step?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) LVAD evaluation

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ LVAD is viable for end-stage HF in non-transplant candidates, improving survival.

questions.text: A 19-year-old woman collapses jogging, pulseless. ECG is shown below. What caused her cardiac arrest?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) AF with pre-excitation

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ AF with pre-excitation (WPW) causes irregular wide-complex tachycardia, risking sudden cardiac arrest.
  • ➤ Image Cue : ECG with irregular wide QRS, varying morphology.
  • ➤ Image Cue

questions.text: A 75-year-old man with reduced energy and confusion has a regular pulse with alternating strength. BP shows alternating Korotkoff sounds. Echocardiogram is shown below. What is the diagnosis?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Severe LV dysfunction

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Pulsus alternans is a hallmark of severe LV dysfunction, prompting HF evaluation.

questions.text: A 67-year-old man with a 45-year smoking history, diagnosed with COPD (FEV₁ 44% predicted), presents post-hospitalization for dyspnea and sputum. He has chronic cough and quit smoking 18 months ago. SpO₂ is 92% on room air. Which therapy best reduces future COPD exacerbation risk?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Roflumilast 500 μg daily

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Roflumilast is effective for reducing exacerbations in severe COPD with chronic bronchitis.

In ICU, he is intubated, on norepinephrine, unresponsive with absent reflexes and myoclonus. Which is true about targeted temperature management (TTM)?

options.label: A
options.text: Brain imaging is required before TTM

options.label: C
options.text: TTM at 33-36°C for 24 hours is beneficial

options.label: D
options.text: TTM is not indicated due to poor prognosis

  • ➤ TTM at 32–34°C is indicated for comatose post-arrest patients to enhance neurological recovery.

questions.text: A 47-year-old woman with recurrent productive cough, breathlessness, and recent joint stiffness presents with fatigue and dry eyes. Auscultation reveals rhonchi and basal crackles. HRCT shows lower lobe bronchiectasis and interstitial markings. Which test is most likely to identify the cause?

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Autoimmune serologies are key in bronchiectasis with systemic symptoms like joint pain and dry eyes.

questions.text: A 36-year-old woman with poorly controlled asthma dies in the ED from respiratory failure despite treatment. Postmortem lung exam is performed. Which pathological feature is not typically found?

questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Inflammatory infiltrates in alveolar spaces

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Asthma affects airways, not alveoli, unlike alveolar-centric diseases.

questions.explanation:
Ans. D) All of the above

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Brain death requires coma, absent brainstem reflexes, and apnea, confirmed clinically.

questions.text: A 62-year-old man in ICU for respiratory failure is intubated. Ventilator mode is changed to patient-initiated breaths with preset pressure, flow-cycled, no mandatory breaths. Ventilator settings are reviewed. Which mode is this?

options.label: B
options.text: Fixed tidal volume for all breaths

questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Patient-triggered, pressure-limited, flow-cycled

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ PSV is a weaning mode, patient-driven, with pressure support and flow-cycling.

questions.text: A 58-year-old woman with severe COPD (FEV₁ 40%) presents with 5-day worsening dyspnea, purulent sputum. ABG: pH 7.28, PaCO₂ 76 mmHg, PaO₂ 52 mmHg. CXR shows no infiltrates. Which treatment most reduces mortality?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Noninvasive positive-pressure ventilation

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ NIPPV is the cornerstone for reducing mortality in hypercapnic COPD exacerbations.

questions.text: A 30-year-old woman with asthma (SABA use 1–2 times/month) now uses SABA 2–3 times/week due to spring allergies. Exam shows end-expiratory wheezing. What is the next management step?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Start inhaled corticosteroid

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ ICS is the preferred step-up therapy for mild persistent asthma.

questions.text: A 35-year-old woman with 3-month dyspnea, dry cough, and low-grade fever works at a pet store cleaning bird enclosures. SpO₂ drops to 89% on walking. HRCT is shown below. Biopsy reveals lymphocytes, plasma cells, noncaseating granulomas. What is the diagnosis?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Hypersensitivity pneumonitis

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ HP is diagnosed by exposure, CT, and granulomas; antigen avoidance is key.

questions.text: A 55-year-old woman with ALS has PaCO₂ 46 mmHg, orthopnea, fatigue, and trouble clearing secretions. Which additional finding supports initiating NIPPV?

Ans. A) Orthopnea

questions.text: Which of the following statements about shock physiology is incorrect?

options.label: A
options.text: Hypotension enhances sympathetic outflow, reduces vagal tone

questions.text: A 40-year-old woman, 5 years post-lung transplant for cystic fibrosis, has dyspnea and FEV₁ drop from 82% to 64% predicted. No infection signs. Which finding suggests bronchiolitis obliterans syndrome (BOS)?

Ans. A) Air trapping on expiratory HRCT

questions.text: A 25-year-old woman with wheezing during workouts and cat exposure has allergic rhinitis, eczema. PFTs is shown below. Which statement is true regarding the diagnosis?

questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Severity remains stable over time

  • ➤ Educational Objective:

questions.text: A 53-year-old woman with chronic green sputum cough, hemoptysis, sinus infections has coarse bilateral crackles. PFTs: FEV₁ 52%, FEV₁/FVC 54%. Sputum grows Pseudomonas. What is the next test?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) High-resolution CT

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ HRCT is diagnostic for bronchiectasis in chronic productive cough.

questions.text: An 80-year-old woman in ICU for bilateral pneumonia has SpO₂ 58% on room air, 80% on nonrebreather. Intubated, on AC mode (tidal volume 6 mL/kg, FiO₂ 100%, PEEP 12 cm H₂O). ABG: pH 7.21, PaCO₂ 31 mmHg, PaO₂ 52 mmHg. CXR is shown. What causes persistent hypoxemia?

questions.text: A 36-year-old woman with 3-month dyspnea, dry cough, fever, working with birds, has SpO₂ drop to 89% on walking. HRCT shows ground-glass, nodules. Biopsy shows lymphocytes, granulomas. What is the treatment?

Ans. C) Glucocorticoids plus antigen avoidance

questions.text: A 75-year-old woman with chronic liver disease, admitted for urosepsis, becomes unresponsive with leftward eye deviation. CT head is normal. Vitals: HR 82, BP 130/88, RR 17, SpO₂ 95%. What explains this?

  • ➤ Conjugate eye deviation suggests frontal lobe seizure, treated with anticonvulsants.

questions.text: A 60-year-old man, 2 years post-kidney transplant, has a seizure, headache, and cortical blindness. On tacrolimus, BP 158/92, normal labs. MRI FLAIR is shown below. What is the cause?

questions.text: A 44-year-old woman with asthma, fatigue, fever, and left foot weakness has peroneal nerve palsy. Which cause is most likely?

questions.text: A 40-year-old woman with fever, pleuritic pain, and dyspnea post-smoking resumption is intubated for hypoxemic failure. CXR is shown. BAL shows 40% eosinophils. What is the next step?

questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Smoking cessation counselling

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Smoking cessation is critical in COPD to halt disease progression.

questions.text: A 58-year-old woman post-SAH coiling becomes drowsy with left weakness on day 8. CT shows no new bleed. On nimodipine, what is the next step?

  • ➤ Vasospasm post-SAH requires vasopressors and potential angioplasty.

questions.text: A 30-year-old woman at 32 weeks pregnant presents with fatigue and abdominal discomfort. BP is 145/95 mmHg. Labs: Hb 7 g/dL, platelets 85,000/µL, elevated liver enzymes. Peripheral smear is shown. Which statement about her condition is false?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Glucocorticoids reduce morbidity/mortality

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ HELLP syndrome requires prompt delivery, not glucocorticoids, for management.

questions.text: A 24-year-old man with fatigue, foot cramps, and muscle spasms has worsening symptoms post-exertion. BP 110/70 mmHg. Labs: K⁺ 2.7 mEq/L, HCO₃⁻ 31 mmol/L, normal Mg²⁺, high urine chloride, negative diuretic screen. What is the diagnosis?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Gitelman syndrome

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Gitelman syndrome presents with hypokalemic alkalosis in normotensive young adults.

questions.text: A 58-year-old woman with stage 5 CKD (eGFR 11 mL/min/1.73 m²) due to diabetic nephropathy has dyspnea and leg swelling despite diuretics. Exam shows elevated JVP, pedal edema. Chest X-ray suggests fluid overload. What is the indication for hemodialysis?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Fluid overload despite diuretics

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Refractory fluid overload is a key indication for dialysis in CKD.

questions.text: A 52-year-old woman with ESRD from hypertension and diabetes on hemodialysis for 6 months has anemia, hyperparathyroidism, and LVH. What is the likely cause of death?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Myocardial infarction

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Cardiovascular events dominate mortality in ESRD patients.

questions.text: A 60-year-old man with septic shock and AKI has urine output <100 mL/24h despite fluids. Labs show acidosis, rising creatinine. Renal ultrasound is normal. Which statement about dialysis in AKI is false?

options.label: B
options.text: High-intensity CRRT has no survival benefit

options.label: C
options.text: Intermittent hemodialysis preferred in cerebral edema

options.label: D
options.text: Peritoneal dialysis usable in select AKI

questions.correct_answer: C. Intermittent hemodialysis preferred in cerebral edema
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Intermittent hemodialysis preferred in cerebral edema

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ CRRT is preferred over intermittent hemodialysis in AKI with cerebral edema.

questions.text: A 65-year-old man with stage 5 CKD will start hemodialysis. He asks about the safest, most durable vascular access. Which statement is true?

options.label: A
options.text: AV grafts have better patency than fistulas

options.label: C
options.text: Nontunneled catheters have lower infection risk

options.label: D
options.text: Subclavian vein preferred for tunneled catheters

questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Fistulas preferred over grafts

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ AV fistulas are the preferred hemodialysis access for durability and safety.

questions.text: A 38-year-old woman with membranous nephropathy presents with leg swelling, frothy urine, and flank pain has 4+ proteinuria, mild hematuria. Ultrasound shows enlarged left kidney. What is the best imaging to confirm?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) MR venography

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ MR venography is the preferred non-invasive test for renal vein thrombosis.

questions.text: A 62-year-old man with stage 4 CKD (Hb 9.6 g/dL, ferritin 150 ng/mL) has fatigue. Kidney biopsy confirms hypertensive nephrosclerosis. Which statement about erythropoietin in CKD is false?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Improves cardiovascular outcomes

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ ESAs manage CKD anemia but lack cardiovascular benefit.
  • ➤ Image Cue : Biopsy showing hypertensive nephrosclerosis.
  • ➤ Image Cue

questions.text: A 72-year-old man with CKD (eGFR 52) will undergo surgery. Which procedure has the highest AKI risk?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Coronary artery bypass grafting

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ CABG poses the highest postoperative AKI risk due to multiple mechanisms.

questions.text: Which nephron segment reabsorbs the most filtered NaCl?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Proximal convoluted tubule

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ PCT is the primary site for NaCl reabsorption in the nephron.

questions.text: A 42-year-old woman with 4.1 g/day proteinuria has normal renal function. Renal biopsy is done and it is shown. Which is not a typical secondary cause of the disroder?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Tuberculosis

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ TB is not a secondary cause of membranous nephropathy, unlike infections, drugs, or cancers.

questions.text: A 58-year-old man with ESRD is evaluated for kidney transplant. What is not part of expanded criteria donor (ECD) definitions?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Donor-specific antibodies in recipient

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ DSA in recipients is a transplant contraindication, not an ECD criterion.

questions.text: A 58-year-old man with septic shock has AKI (Cr 3.2 mg/dL, oliguria). Urinalysis shows the finding below. Ultrasound of the abdomen is normal. Which agent improves outcomes in this condition?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) None of the above

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ ATI in AKI requires supportive care, not specific pharmacologic agents.

questions.text: A 60-year-old woman with cervical cancer history has new kidney dysfunction (Cr 4.2 mg/dL, BUN 70 mg/dL), fatigue, and flank pain. What is the next step?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Renal ultrasound

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Renal ultrasound screens for obstruction in AKI with malignancy history.

questions.text: A 46-year-old man 3 months post-renal transplant on tacrolimus, prednisone, and another immunosuppressant has diarrhea. Transplant biopsy is normal. Which drug, inhibiting purine synthesis, likely causes this?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Mycophenolate mofetil

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Mycophenolate causes diarrhea in transplant patients via purine synthesis inhibition.

questions.text: A 26-year-old man with Cr 1.5 mg/dL, no urinary symptoms, and childhood UTIs has small, asymmetric kidneys on ultrasound. What is the cause?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Reflux nephropathy

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Reflux nephropathy from childhood UTIs leads to scarred, small kidneys.

questions.text: A 30-year-old woman with ADPKD has no neurological symptoms but worries about intracranial aneurysms. Kidney ultrasound confirms cysts. Which statement is correct?
questions.correct_answer: A. Hypertension increases aneurysm rupture risk
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Hypertension increases aneurysm rupture risk

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Hypertension is a modifiable risk for aneurysm rupture in ADPKD.

questions.text: A 52-year-old obese woman with hypertension has 5.4 g/day proteinuria, Cr 1.1 mg/dL, no hematuria. Renal biopsy is done and it is shown below. What is the diagnosis?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Focal segmental glomerulosclerosis

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ FSGS is a common cause of nephrotic proteinuria in obesity/hypertension.

questions.text: A 35-year-old woman with confusion, fever, Hb 8.8 g/dL, platelets 15,000/µL, Cr 2.6 mg/dL, and hematuria has no recent diarrhea. What finding is consistent with her diagnosis?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Schistocytes

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ TTP is diagnosed by schistocytes and low ADAMTS13 activity.

questions.text: A 27-year-old man with type 1 diabetes has 3.2 g/day proteinuria, Cr 1.1 mg/dL. Fundus exam is shown. What is characteristic of kidney involvement due to the disease?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Diabetic retinopathy

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Diabetic nephropathy in type 1 diabetes strongly correlates with retinopathy.

questions.text: A 47-year-old woman presents with painful ear swelling sparing the earlobes, hoarseness, and blurred vision. Exam findings are shown. Which disorders are most commonly associated?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) B and C

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Relapsing polychondritis often coexists with GPA and RA.

questions.text: A 42-year-old man has digital clubbing. Which condition is not associated?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Clubbing absence in COPD prompts further investigation.

questions.text: A 16-year-old boy with fever, joint pain post-sore throat has swollen knees/ankles and a soft systolic murmur . What is the most common presentation of his diagnosis?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Polyarthritis

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Polyarthritis dominates ARF presentation.

questions.text: A 76-year-old man with sudden pain/swelling in the left first MTP joint, on thiazide for hypertension, has erythematous, tender joint. Arthrocentesis shows the following. What is the metabolic derangement?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Uric acid overproduction

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Gout stems from uric acid dysregulation, confirmed by crystal analysis.

questions.text: A 50-year-old woman presents with symmetrical joint pain and morning stiffness >1 hour. Her joints are shown in the image below. She also has subcutaneous nodules. Which joint is most commonly involved in established disease?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Wrist

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Wrist involvement is hallmark in RA.

questions.text: A 30-year-old man in ICU with hemoptysis, dyspnea has Cr 5.2 mg/dL, pulmonary infiltrates, hematuria. Anti-GBM antibodies confirm Goodpasture syndrome. What is the immune mechanism?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Complement-activating autoantibody

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Complement activation drives Goodpasture syndrome damage.

questions.text: A 58-year-old woman with 6-year primary Sjögren syndrome has 3-month parotid swelling, cervical lymphadenopathy, weight loss. Labs: leukopenia, low C4. Likely diagnosis?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Lymphoma

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Lymphoma risk rises in Sjögren with parotid swelling, low C4.

questions.text: A 30-year-old man with knee swelling, dactylitis post-diarrhea has dysuria. Works in childcare with similar GI cases. Likely causative organism?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Shigella flexneri

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Shigella is a key cause of post-diarrheal reactive arthritis.

questions.text: A 32-year-old man with lower back stiffness improving with activity, morning stiffness > 1 hour Xray is shown. What percentage of patients with this condition are HLA-B27 positive?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) 80%

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ High HLA-B27 positivity in AS aids diagnosis.

questions.text: A 60-year-old woman with dry mouth, eye irritation needs water to eat, has photosensitivity. Exam: dry oral mucosa, no Raynaud’s. Which test is least likely positive?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Scl-70 antibody

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Scl-70 is specific to systemic sclerosis, not Sjögren.

questions.text: A 63-year-old man with proximal muscle pain/weakness post-statin (stopped 3 weeks ago) has CK 12x ULN. What test confirms diagnosis?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Anti-HMG-CoA reductase antibody

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Anti-HMG-CoA confirms statin-induced IMNM.

questions.text: A 48-year-old woman with systemic sclerosis, diffuse skin thickening has headache, confusion, leg swelling, BP 220/110 mmHg, Cr rise, schistocytes. Initial treatment?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Captopril

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Captopril is critical for SRC management.

questions.text: A 42-year-old woman with SLE, recurrent miscarriages has antiphospholipid antibodies. Which statement about antiphospholipid syndrome is incorrect?

options.label: D
options.text: Most lupus patients with antibodies develop thrombosis/loss

questions.correct_answer: D. Most lupus patients with antibodies develop thrombosis/loss
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Most lupus patients with antibodies develop thrombosis/loss

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Few SLE patients with antiphospholipid antibodies develop APS.

questions.text: A 28-year-old man with drug use history has bilateral parotid enlargement, dry mouth, no eye/joint symptoms. Ro/SS-A, La/SS-B negative. Likely diagnosis?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) HIV infection

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ HIV mimics sicca with parotid enlargement, negative serology.

questions.text: A 41-year-old man with chronic psoriasis has wrist/knee pain, erosive changes on X-ray. Which medication is least effective for skin/joint symptoms?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Rituximab

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Rituximab is not used in PsA, unlike other biologics.

questions.text: A 55-year-old woman with prior incarceration has 15 mm induration 72 hours post-tuberculin skin test. This reaction represents which immune response?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Delayed-type hypersensitivity

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ PPD elicits DTH, indicating TB sensitization.

questions.text: A 45-year-old man with pulmonary sarcoidosis has palpitations, fatigue. ECG shows PVCs, echo mild LV dysfunction. Which cardiac manifestations are due to sarcoidosis granulomas?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Decreased ejection fraction

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Cardiac sarcoidosis causes arrhythmias, heart failure via granulomas.

questions.text: A 57-year-old man with right elbow pain after pulling luggage has tenderness over lateral epicondyle, pain with wrist extension. Most appropriate management?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) NSAIDs and rest

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Tennis elbow managed with NSAIDs, rest, injections.

questions.text: A 40-year-old woman presents with skin lesions as shown in the image. She also has dry cough. CXR is done and it is shown. What is the likely diagnosis?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Lupus pernio

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Lupus pernio is a sarcoidosis-specific facial rash.

questions.text: A 60-year-old man with psoriasis, joint aches post-infliximab has a rash as shown below. ANA 1:320. Which autoantibody is likely present?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Anti-histone antibodies

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Anti-histone antibodies hallmark DIL from TNF inhibitors.
